reviews.review: A timeless classic from the days of Steam's infancy, and my favourite unofficial TRON game. Give it a whirl if you've had it sitting in your game collection since 2006!

[h1] More than just a game [/h1]

How can I describe this game to someone who hasn't played it? Truly that out of every single game Valve has ever blessed us with Ricochet is the best one, never before had a game achieved such gripping game play, such life-like graphics and such deep lore. If I had just 5 hours left to live I would spend all 5 playing Ricochet.

Ne≈ô√≠k√°m ≈æe je to ≈°patn√° hra, ale kdy≈æ jsem si ji nainstaloval, zjistil jsem ≈æe neexistuje server na kter√©m by byl aspo≈à 1 ƒçlovƒõk a tato hra nejde pokud nejsou na serveru alespo≈à 2. Tud√≠≈æ jsem nemƒõl ≈°anci si zahr√°t a nedoporuƒçuji tuto hru proto≈æe v√°m ned√°v√° mo≈ænost ji hr√°t.

[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[i]A tame, fun and playful game until you decapitate people.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
+Intense fast-paced action game, similar to TRON
+Multiple types of discs and platforms providing many strategies
+Smooth gameplay for a game from 2000
+Team, 1v1, and Free for All
+A nice simplistic UI, scoreboard, kill feed, etc.

[h1]The Ok Stuff[/h1]
=You have to just simply jump in and learn the game, no tutorial or anything to help you out, however it's easy to pick up and slay people 
=I'm recommending this game in the hope more people buy this game, because it is truly fun but there's no one to play with just like myself IRL... I'm in my parent's basement watching streams and scarfing down pizza rolls... send help

[h1]The Bad Stuff[/h1]
-Overpriced a little by itself ($4.99), buy it in the Counter-Strike 1 Anthology to get the best buck for bang with CS 1.6, CS:CZ and Deathmatch
--The community is dead unfortunately, only been able to play it once for about 10 minutes. An enjoyable 10 minutes however, just like my (non-existant) sex life

[h1]The Truthful Hard Facts[/h1]
[table]
[tr][td]Acquirement Method[/td][th]Counter-Strike 1 Anthology from Steam Store[/th][/tr]
[tr][td]Price Paid[/td][th]$14.96[/th][/tr]
[tr][td]Community[/td][th]20-30 at it's peak[/th][/tr]

[h1]What Makes This Game S.P.E.C.I.A.L.[/h1]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/KyleJames0408]Key to the Review[/url]
[b]S[/b] ‚Ä¢ 6/10 | Only fun if you have friends as it is a dead game.
[b]P[/b] ‚Ä¢ 6/10 | Outdated engine, graphics and sounds, like the original Half-Life.
[b]E[/b] ‚Ä¢ 5/10 | Very low replayability and an average time can be spent in game with friends.
[b]C[/b] ‚Ä¢ 3/10 | Depressing to see nobody plays the game after purchase.
[b]I[/b] ‚Ä¢ 3/10 | Pretty mindless play.
[b]A[/b] ‚Ä¢ 3/10 | No campaign, play times vary by interest in game.
[b]L[/b] ‚Ä¢ 6/10 | Lot of skill, lot of luck, decent ratio.

[h1]Original Review[/h1]
Hello Fellow Players,
I can not recommend Ricochet. It's actually a pretty fun game if you can get some people to play, but that's just it, there are plenty of servers but absolutely no players! I enjoy the mechanics of jumping from platform to platform and throwing discs, but there's nobody else to play with, therefore, no competition. It's another deathmatch type game that would be a lot of fun if people still played, however, they don't. It's only because there are no players that I strongly advise you to refrain from purchasing this game unless you plan on playing it on several occasions with a bunch of friends. Definitely not worth the money, the games time has passed.
-Kyle James

Ricochet is an official Half Life mod released in 2000. I had heard of it many times, but never played. It was already in the library -came within the Valve Pack- so I wanted to give a try today (19.03.2017) and surprise: It is a multiplayer game. And there is NOONE playing it. Yes, literally nobody was online.

I have no idea about gameplay, how fun it is or any other thing since I couldn't play it. Therefore I do not recommend it just based on the reason that there is nobody playing it.

So, do NOT buy it seperately.

P.S: I am not sure if anyone would care about my review. It is such an old and dead game maybe everyone already is aware of the situation.

HuronianCryogenianAndeanKarooQuaternaryAxis scale: millions of years.
Orange labels: periods of known ice ages.
Also see: Human timeline & Nature timeline
Main articles: Abiogenesis and Evolutionary history of life

Speculative phylogenetic tree of life on Earth based on rRNA analysis
Chemical reactions led to the first self‚Äìreplicating molecules about four billion years ago. A half billion years later, the last common ancestor of all life arose.[73] The evolution of photosynthesis allowed the Sun's energy to be harvested directly by life forms. The resultant molecular oxygen (O2) accumulated in the atmosphere and due to interaction with ultraviolet solar radiation, formed a protective ozone layer (O3) in the upper atmosphere.[74] The incorporation of smaller cells within larger ones resulted in the development of complex cells called eukaryotes.[75] True multicellular organisms formed as cells within colonies became increasingly specialized. Aided by the absorption of harmful ultraviolet radiation by the ozone layer, life colonized Earth's surface.[76] Among the earliest fossil evidence for life is microbial mat fossils found in 3.48 billion-year-old sandstone in Western Australia,[77][78][79][80][81] biogenic graphite found in 3.7 billion-year-old metasedimentary rocks in Western Greenland,[82] remains of biotic material found in 4.1 billion-year-old rocks in Western Australia.[33][34]

During the Neoproterozoic, 750 to 580 Mya, much of Earth might have been covered in ice. This hypothesis has been termed "Snowball Earth", and it is of particular interest because it preceded the Cambrian explosion, when multicellular life forms significantly increased in complexity.[83] Following the Cambrian explosion, 535 Mya, there have been five major mass extinctions.[84] The most recent such event was 66 Mya, when an asteroid impact triggered the extinction of the non-avian dinosaurs and other large reptiles, but spared some small animals such as mammals, which then resembled shrews. Over the past 66 Ma, mammalian life has diversified, and several million years ago an African ape-like animal such as Orrorin tugenensis gained the ability to stand upright.[85] This facilitated tool use and encouraged communication that provided the nutrition and stimulation needed for a larger brain, which allowed the evolution of humans. The development of agriculture, and then civilization, led to humans having an influence on Earth and the nature and quantity of other life forms that continues today.[86]

Predicted future
Main article: Future of Earth
See also: Global catastrophic risk
Earth's long-term future is closely tied to that of the Sun. Over the next 1.1 Ga, solar luminosity will increase by 10%, and over the next 3.5 Ga by 40%.[87] The Earth's increasing surface temperature will accelerate the inorganic CO2 cycle, reducing its concentration to levels lethally low for plants (10 ppm for C4 photosynthesis) in approximately 500‚Äì900 Ma.[88] The lack of vegetation will result in the loss of oxygen in the atmosphere, and animal life will become extinct.[89] After another billion years all surface water will have disappeared[90] and the mean global temperature will reach 70 ¬∞C[89] (158 ¬∞F). From that point, the Earth is expected to be habitable for another 500 Ma,[88] possibly up to 2.3 Ga if nitrogen is removed from the atmosphere.[91] Even if the Sun were eternal and stable, 27% of the water in the modern oceans will descend to the mantle in one billion years, due to reduced steam venting from mid-ocean ridges.[92]

The Sun will evolve to become a red giant in about 5 Ga. Models predict that the Sun will expand to roughly 1 AU (150,000,000 km), which is about 250 times its present radius.[87][93] Earth's fate is less clear. As a red giant, the Sun will lose roughly 30% of its mass, so, without tidal effects, Earth will move to an orbit 1.7 AU from the Sun when the star reaches its maximum radius. Most, if not all, remaining life will be destroyed by the Sun's increased luminosity (peaking at about 5,000 times its present level).[87] A 2008 simulation indicates that Earth's orbit will eventually decay due to tidal effects and drag, causing it to enter the Sun's atmosphere and be vaporized.[93]

Physical characteristics
Shape

Shape of planet Earth. Shown are distances between surface relief and the geocentre. The South American Andes summits are visible as elevated areas. Data from the Earth2014[94] global relief model.
Main article: Figure of the Earth
The shape of Earth is approximately oblate spheroidal. Due to rotation, the Earth is flattened along the geographic axis and bulging around the equator.[95] The diameter of the Earth at the equator is 43 kilometres (27 mi) larger than the pole-to-pole diameter.[96] Thus the point on the surface farthest from Earth's center of mass is the summit of the equatorial Chimborazo volcano in Ecuador.[97][98][99][100] The average diameter of the reference spheroid is 12,742 kilometres (7,918 mi). Local topography deviates from this idealized spheroid, although on a global scale these deviations are small compared to Earth's radius: The maximum deviation of only 0.17% is at the Mariana Trench (10,911 metres (35,797 ft) below local sea level), whereas Mount Everest (8,848 metres (29,029 ft) above local sea level) represents a deviation of 0.14%.[n 15]

Chemical composition
See also: Abundance of elements on Earth
Chemical composition of the crust[102]
Compound	Formula	Composition
Continental	Oceanic
silica	SiO2	60.2%	48.6%
alumina	Al2O3	15.2%	16.5%
lime	CaO	5.5%	12.3%
magnesia	MgO	3.1%	6.8%
iron(II) oxide	FeO	3.8%	6.2%
sodium oxide	Na2O	3.0%	2.6%
potassium oxide	K2O	2.8%	0.4%
iron(III) oxide	Fe2O3	2.5%	2.3%
water	H2O	1.4%	1.1%
carbon dioxide	CO2	1.2%	1.4%
titanium dioxide	TiO2	0.7%	1.4%
phosphorus pentoxide	P2O5	0.2%	0.3%
Total	99.6%	99.9%
Earth's mass is approximately 5.97√ó1024 kg (5,970 Yg). It is composed mostly of iron (32.1%), oxygen (30.1%), silicon (15.1%), magnesium (13.9%), sulfur (2.9%), nickel (1.8%), calcium (1.5%), and aluminium (1.4%), with the remaining 1.2% consisting of trace amounts of other elements. Due to mass segregation, the core region is estimated to be primarily composed of iron (88.8%), with smaller amounts of nickel (5.8%), sulfur (4.5%), and less than 1% trace elements.[103]

The most common rock constituents of the crust are nearly all oxides: chlorine, sulfur, and fluorine are the important exceptions to this and their total amount in any rock is usually much less than 1%. Over 99% of the crust is composed of 11 oxides, principally silica, alumina, iron oxides, lime, magnesia, potash, and soda.[102][103][104]

Internal structure
Main article: Structure of the Earth
Earth's interior, like that of the other terrestrial planets, is divided into layers by their chemical or physical (rheological) properties. The outer layer is a chemically distinct silicate solid crust, which is underlain by a highly viscous solid mantle. The crust is separated from the mantle by the Mohoroviƒçiƒá discontinuity. The thickness of the crust varies from about 6 km (kilometers) under the oceans to 30‚Äì50 km for the continents. The crust and the cold, rigid, top of the upper mantle are collectively known as the lithosphere, and it is of the lithosphere that the tectonic plates are composed.

Fantastic classic valve game! Been playing since I had steam, and I love this game. As the saying doesn't go, only takes minutes to fall in love with this game, but a lifetime to master! Try it!

You throw discs sorta like tron, but they don't come back. You get three, and they auto replenish after a short time. There are power-ups for your discs like freeze shot or fast shot. The object is to knock others off their platforms (or even do a special, but costly power shot for killer results) without being knocked off yourself, the player with the most points wins, depending on the game rules. The discs "ricochet" off of walls a number of times, and the more ricochets it does before knocking someone down adds up the points for a successful kill. Stepping on an arrow lauches you to other arrows and platforms. There are no teams, it is a free-for-all to rack up points...Happy throwing!

Es un gran juego, Muy divertido y con un potencial increible.

Lo negativo es que hay algunos bugs sin reparar, No hay mas mapas nuevos oficiales ni ningun tipo de actualizacion por parte de Valve, Esto tampoco incluye el desarollo de una Secuela (que seria genial ver) o algun DLC que introduzca mas opciones y/o funcionalidades, como mas Discos, opcion de cubrirte o rebotar discos, Saltar, etc.

Ya casi nadie lo juega y es raro encontrar un game con mas de 5 o 6 personas adentro.
No vi muchos mods hechos por la comunidad, ni mapas, ni otras cuestiones que involucren al juego.
Falta de modos de juego: Capturar la bandera, Team deathmatch, etc.

basicamente sufrio el mismo destino que Gunz 2, Demigod, Evolve o the Division, Fueron abandonados, Quedan ahi como un recuerdo de que alguna vez fueron grandes, pero podrian llegar a serlo.

Valve se comporto extra√±o durante estos ultimos 5 a√±os especialmente, sacando casi literalmente Ningun juego ni haciendo actualizaciones a los que ya tiene, sacando peque√±as excepciones, como parcheos al Dota y el VR de Portal 2 y otras minutas.

Es poco probable que hagan algo por el juego, pero aun asi como esta, se pueden armar premades con amigos y jugar, de 4 personas o mas para tener partidas divertidas.

Good game, no players

One day a timer will appear on the Steam front page.
No one knows it's purpose and Valve will remain silent as usual.
For days people speculate that the announcement of Half Life 3 is imminent.
When the timer reaches the last few seconds, it freezes on the number 3. For a moment nothing happens and the world watches in anticipation.
Suddenly Gabe Newell's face appears on the screen.
"Valve is proud to announce a long anticipated game from a series that the fans have been excited to return to for many years."
He pauses for a moment and smiles, "It was worth the wait."
Suddenly, men and women all over the world have earth shattering orgasms, all diseases are cured, world hunger is solved, and all wars instantly come to an end.
"I am pleased to announce Ricochet 2."

Seguramente cualquiera que tenga una cuenta de Steam tendr√° Ricochet sin saber por qu√© lo tiene, la gente no entiende lo genial que es este... hijo especialito de Tron, y el abandono de los jugadores al producto hizo que la ausencia en casi todo momento de un alma en los servidores haya sido la principal queja de los comunes de los mortales hacia esta curiosa pieza.
En el d√≠a de la fecha he sido parte de un grupo de diez personas para jugar esta joya y ha sido asombroso, con el simple y s√≥lido objetivo de matarse los unos a los otros saltando plataformas y lanzando discos, en un cuasieterno enfrentamiento donde nadie gana, todos sufren pero tambi√©n disfrutan al sufrir. 

[i] Cuando acabe el mundo volveremos a los '80 y estaremos en un limbo lleno de plataformas rojas y azules y gritos perdi√©ndose en el infinito para volver y seguir gritando¬≠. [/i]
